5 stage productions to see Dec. 17-23

Theater and comedy lineup for the weekend and beyond

5 stage productions to see Dec. 17-23

Louisville 7:37 a.m. EST December 17, 2014

Empty stage with curtains slightly open and spotlight on(Photo: Getty Images)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

"The Most Famous Reindeer of All." Derby Dinner Playhouse, 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, Saturday. Breakfast, 9 a.m., show, 10 a.m.; lunch, noon, show 1:15 p.m. Part of Derby Dinner Playhouse Children's Theater. Through Dec. 20. $16 breakfast, $21, lunch. (812) 288-8281.

Dave Chappelle. Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St., 7 and 9:30 p.m.Saturday; 7 p.m. Sunday. $55. (800) 745-3000.

Louisville Ballet. Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7:30 p.m. Friday; 1:30 and 7:30 p.m Saturday and Sunday. "Brown-Forman Nutcracker." $32-$105. (502) 584-7777.

"The Bible: The Complete Word of God (Abridged)." The Alley Theatre, 633 W. Main St., 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Through Jan. 17. $15, $12 for students and seniors. www.thealletytheater.com.

"A Christmas Carol." Pamela Brown Auditorium, Actors Theatre of Louisville, 316 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Thursday, Friday and Monday; 2 and 7 p.m. Saturday, Sunday and Tuesday. $25-$65. (502) 584-1205.

AROUND TOWN: 5 fun things Dec. 17-23

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music Dec. 17-23

TAKE THE KIDS: Top fun things for families Dec. 17-23

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out Dec. 17-23

And lots more on local stages ...

Children's theater

"The Most Famous Reindeer of All." Derby Dinner Playhouse, 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, Saturday. Breakfast, 9 a.m., show, 10 a.m.; lunch, noon, show 1:15 p.m. Part of Derby Dinner Playhouse Children's Theater. Through Dec. 20. $16 breakfast, $21, lunch. (812) 288-8281.

A KaLightoscope Christmas Carol. Galt House Hotel, 140 N. Fourth St., 10 a.m. Thursday-Saturday, Monday and Tuesday; noon Sunday and Dec. 24. Presented by Christmas at the Galt House Hotel. Features KaLightoscope Luminaries, Snow Fairy Princess, Peppermint Express Train, holiday-themed live performances, letter writing to Santa, gingerbread contest and more. Through Jan. 1. $12, $5 for ages 4-12. (502) 584-7777.

"Best Christmas Pageant Ever." Bomhard Theater, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 2 and 5 p.m. Saturday. StageOne Family Theatre. $20, $15 for ages 12 and younger. (502) 584-7777.

Comedy

Dave Chappelle. Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St., 7 and 9:30 p.m.Saturday; 7 p.m. Sunday. $55. (800) 745-3000.

Nate Bargatze. The Laughing Derby at the Comedy Caravan, 1250 Bardstown Road, 7:15 p.m. Thursday; 7:15 and 9:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday. $12 Thursday, $15 Friday and Saturday. (502) 459-0022.

Dance

Louisville Ballet. Whitney Hall, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 7:30 p.m. Friday; 1:30 and 7:30 p.m Saturday and Sunday. "Brown-Forman Nutcracker." $32-$105. (502) 584-7777.

Student production

"Uncle Vanya." Walden Theatre, 1123 Payne St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday and Friday; 2 and 7:30 p.m. Saturday. Matinee, $10, $8 for students and seniors; Evening, $15, $10 for students and seniors. (502) 589-0084.

Theater

"The Bible: The Complete Word of God (Abridged)." The Alley Theatre, 633 W. Main St., 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Through Jan. 17. $15, $12 for students and seniors. www.thealletytheater.com.

"A Christmas Carol." Pamela Brown Auditorium, Actors Theatre of Louisville, 316 W. Main St., 7 p.m. Thursday, Friday and Monday; 2 and 7 p.m. Saturday, Sunday and Tuesday. $25-$65. (502) 584-1205.

"The Day They Shot John Lennon." Martin Experimental Theatre, Kentucky Center, 501 W. Main St., 8 p.m.Friday and Saturday; 2 p.m. Sunday. Presented by Actor's Choice Theatre. Through Dec. 21. $17. (502) 584-7777.

"Forgive Me, It's Christmas." The Henry Clay, 604 S. Third St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday-Saturday; 2:30 p.m. Sunday. Bunbury Theatre. $22, $19 seniors, $10 students 24 and younger and children. (502) 585-5306.

"Haul Out the Holly (a Holiday Revue)." Vault1031, 1031 S. Sixth St., 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Presented by Sock Drawer Productions. $15, $12 for groups of 20 or more. (502) 500-1131.

"The Kings of Christmas." The Bard's Town, 1801 Bardstown Road, 7:30 p.m. Thursday-Sunday. $15, $12 for students and seniors. thebardstown.com.

"The Twelve Murders of Christmas." Hilton Garden Inn-Airport, 2735 Crittenden Drive, 7 p.m. Saturday. Presented by WhoDunnit Murder Mystery Dinner Theatre. Through Jan. 3. $45.50 includes dinner, show, tax and gratuity. (502) 426-7100.

"A Wonderful Life." Derby Dinner Playhouse, 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, 7:45 p.m. Friday-Saturday and Tuesday; 1:30 and 7:45 p.m. Sunday; 1 and 7:45 p.m. Dec. 3. Through Dec. 31. $36-$45. (812) 288-8281.
